com.yantra.api.ycd

Interface createStoreBatch

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCDApi, YIFApi

    public interface createStoreBatch

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document createStoreBatch(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The createStoreBatch API takes shipment lines in the input and creates batch record.

    • Method Detail

      • createStoreBatch

        org.w3c.dom.Document createStoreBatch(YFSEnvironment env,
                                      org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                      java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                      com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException

        The createStoreBatch API takes shipment lines in the input and creates batch record.

        The Batch record is created for the store with its OrganizationCode and all the valid shipment lines are updated with StoreBatchKey.

        The IncludedInBatch flag is updated as Y for the shipments included in the batch.

        If IgnoreInvalidLines is passed in the input as Y, invalid shipment lines are returned as part of the DiscardedShipmentLines element in the API output and the batch is created with the valid lines. If IgnoreInvalidLines is passed in the input as N, the batch is not created and input document is returned as output with FailureMessage attribute.

        The BatchPickPriority attribute for a shipment line is calculated based on ExpectedShipmentDate of the shipment. BatchPickPriority is the sequence in which shipment lines that contain the same item are picked in a batch.

        In a multicolony environment, PrimaryKey Fact should be passed to identify the correct colony.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        Validations:


          OrganizationCode is mandatory and it should be configured as a ship node.

          A shipment line is discarded if -

        • Primary Key or Unique is not passed.


        • If the shipment line is part of another batch.


        • If backroom pick has already started for the shipment line.


        • Shipment status is not valid. Valid statuses being Ready for Backroom Pick(1100.70.06.10) and Backroom Pick in Progress(1100.70.06.20) or their extended statuses.


        • Order picking has been started for the shipment i.e. status is Backroom Pick in Progress(1100.70.06.20) and IncludedInBatch flag on Shipment is not Y.


        • IsPickable flag is N for the shipment line.


        User Exits:
          This API calls the following user exit.
          com.yantra.pca.ywe.japi.ue.YCDGetBatchPickPriorityUE
          This user exit can be used to calculate BatchPickPriority based on a custom logic.

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre Conditions: None

        Post Conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Partial. Only Batch element is template controlled.

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        A XML document that contains batch details. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Yantra exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
